description: Matches any single character except a return or newline characters(line break)
Character class. Matches any character contained between the square brackets. Use a hyphen inside a character set to specify the characters' range.
Negative character class. Matches any character that is not contained between the square brackets
Repetitions - Matches 0 or more repetitions of the preceding symbol
Repetitions - Matches 1 or more repetitions of the preceding symbol
Repetitions - Make the preceding symbol optional
Braces. Matches at least "n" but not more than "m" repetitions of the preceding symbol
Character group. Matches the characters xyz in that exact order
Alternation. Matches either the characters before or the characters after the symbol.
Escapes the net character. This allows to match reserved characters like [ ] ( ) { } . * + ? ^ $ \ |
Matches the beginning of the input
Matches the end of the input
